task.title: Allocation Tutorial
task.shortdesc: This tutorial describes how to allocate MBufs (for data source components in the Data Plane).

context.p: The RMBufChain::Alloc() function allocates the specified amount of memory as a chain of one or several RMBuf objects from the Comms pond. If the pond cannot provide the memory area as a single buffer, the chain contains as many RMBuf s linked together as necessary to fulfil the allocation request.

step.info: You should use the allocation methods of the parent class (RCommsBufChain): see the TLS Look-up Reduction Tutorial.
Note: some of the overloaded Alloc() methods specify minimum and maximum values. See Allocation Strategy.

step.cmd: Check the return value for errors.
step.info: The Alloc() methods return KErrNone if the memory is available as RMBuf in the RMBufChain.

step.cmd: Use the allocated buffer (see Data Access Example).

example.title: Examples
example.p: The following example requests 1,800 bytes to the Comms pond. iAllocator is an RMBufAllocator member of the class implementing this example.
example.codeblock:
RMBufChain aChain;
TInt err = chain.Alloc(1800, iAllocator);
example.p: The following example requests 1,200 bytes and specifies a minimum and a maximum size of 1,600 bytes. If there are no available 1,600-byte buffers in the pond then an error is returned.
example.codeblock:
RMBufChain chain;
Tint err = chain.Alloc(1200, 1600, 1600, iAllocator);
